'''Helm's Gate''' was the entrance to the deep gorge of [[Helm's Deep]]<ref>{{HM|UI}}, entry ''Helm's Gate'', p. 414</ref> on the northern side of the [[White Mountains]].<ref>{{FR|Map}}</ref>

It was fortified by the [[Deeping Wall]],<ref>{{HM|UI}}, entry ''Deeping Wall'', p. 531</ref> which ran from the southern side of the cliff wall of the gorge to the [[Hornburg]], a fortress on an heel of rock that was thrust outward from the northern side of the cliff wall, to block the entrance to Helm's Deep.<ref name=Deep>{{TT|Deep}}, p. 528</ref>

The [[Deeping-stream]] flowed out of Helm's Deep through a wide culvert at the bottom of the Deeping Wall into the [[Westfold Vale]].<ref name=Deep/>

On the [[3 March|3]]-[[4 March]] {{TA|3019}} the forces of [[Théoden]], the [[King of Rohan]], defended the Deeping Wall and the Hornburg against the army of [[Saruman]] in the [[Battle of the Hornburg]],<ref>{{App|Great}}, entry for the year 3019, March 3 and 4 p. 1093</ref> during this battle the wall guarding the gate was partially destroyed.<ref>{{TT|Deep}}, p. 537</ref>

==Etymology==
The element ''Helm'' in the name ''Helm's Gate'' refers to the name of a man called Helm.<ref>{{HM|N}}, '''Helm's Deep, Helm's Dike, Helm's Gate''', entry, p. 772</ref> The gorge behind the Hornburg was called Helm's Deep after King [[Helm]] of Rohan sought refuge in the Hornburg when his realm was invaded by the ursurper [[Wulf]] and the Dunlendings.<ref>{{App|Eorl}}, entry for King Helm, p. 1066</ref> As a consequence, it is probable that the element ''Helm'' in ''Helm's Gate'' also refers to King Helm of Rohan.
